ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC DIF options;

Converts a DIF file to SAS data set or a SAS data set to a DIF file.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DIF=fileref|FILENAME]      
      
Specifies the fileref or filename of a DIF file.

[Syntax: DATA=<libref.>member]      
      
Names the input SAS data set.

[Syntax: OUT=<libref.>member]      
      
Names the SAS data set to hold the converted data.

Causes PROC DIF to write the names of the SAS variables as the first row of the
DIF file and a row of blanks as the second row of the DIF file.

[Syntax: PREFIX=name]      
      
Specifies a prefix to be used in constructing SAS variable names when you are
converting a DIF file to a SAS data set.

[Syntax: SKIP=n]      
      
Specifies the number of rows, beginning at the top of the DIF file, to be
ignored when converting a DIF file to a SAS data set.
